John Milosevic

Dear Readers
 I have been following thi whole Iran thing. I have heard this thing on the radio, the television, and on the computer about the possibility of sanctions on Iran. What are sanctions? What is that to do for that country? I mean is it like going to be, "Ok Mr. Iran, here are your sanctions".
 "Ok, I guess that is the end of my nuclear program."
 Come on. What can sanctions do to prevent weapons or whatever the hell they are doing?
 I think I know what it is.
 But, I also heard that they removed all their money from all European banks. So, if it is what I think it is, I don't know.
 Anyway. Please explain. I searched on the internet, and it gave me something other than what I was looking for.
 -John

 Sanctions are usually conditional, as in the case of Saddam. So it's not so much the sanctions that cause deaths and/or other problems, but the ruler's unwillingness to relent. Pride kills a lot of people. UN sanctions have to be done, in many cases.
georged

I was not meaning to debate about sanctions. I was just wondering what they are. I asked that question on google, and ask jeeves, and it gave me pop ups, and weird sites like how to buy a sanction and al that rubish.
 Sorry. Just wondered what it was. I hear sanction this, santion that, and I did not know what it was.
 -John

 
 To put economic sanctions in simpler terms, if your neighbor doesn't concede to your demand of not growing potatoes because you fear potatoes will in some manner provide your neighbor with an ability to equal your achievements and power, you attempt to block your neigbor's ability to grow potatoes by restricting his/her ability to obtain seed, fertilizer and sunlight. 
 
 If your neighbor is smart, he/she will trade with other neighbors who don't share your opinion for seed, fertilizer and sunlight and want to buy your potatoes and associated crops. If you're successful, then comes neighborhood war.
Maineiac

To put economic sanctions in simpler terms, if your neighbor doesn't concede to your demand of not growing potatoes because you fear potatoes will in some manner provide your neighbor with an ability to equal your achievements and power, you attempt to block your neigbor's ability to grow potatoes by restricting his/her ability to obtain seed, fertilizer and sunlight. 
 
 If your neighbor is smart, he/she will trade with other neighbors who don't share your opinion for seed, fertilizer and sunlight and want to buy your potatoes and associated crops. If you're successful, then comes neighborhood war.

 
 The ability of the neighbor to financially coerce (sanction) his other neighbor becomes increasingly more difficult as his popularity in the neighborhood declines.

 This one looks like we're again taking the lead and hopefully it won't turn out as disastrous as our Iraq folly.
Maineiac

This one looks like we're again taking the lead and hopefully it won't turn out as disastrous as our Iraq folly.

 
 I hope your wrong george. In the case of Iran, I think the U.S. has the most to lose in placing sanctions on Iran. Our image in the ME is getting worse everyday. Another stand-off with an oil rich nation is something we can't afford.
 
 Look what just mentioning the word did for oil prices.
 
 It's time to let other nations defend their interests. As far as I know they could't hit us directly. They are more of a threat to their neighboring countries. We don't need the oil for our supply. It's the supply of other nations it will hurt. 
 
 Let Russia and China put the pressure on Iran. Russia has already offered to allow them to do their research there. Let France and Britian draw the line with Iran. We would have to be involved, but not the first one to jump on the table pointing fingers at Iran. 
 
 In the event that Iran did develop a nuclear bomb , or was close to one, Isaeral will strike first. They won't have a choice, at that point, for Isaeral, it's us or them. I hope it doesn't come to that.
georged

I hope your wrong george. In the case of Iran, I think the U.S. has the most to lose in placing sanctions on Iran. Our image in the ME is getting worse everyday. Another stand-off with an oil rich nation is something we can't afford.
 
 Look what just mentioning the word did for oil prices.
 
 It's time to let other nations defend their interests. As far as I know they could't hit us directly. They are more of a threat to their neighboring countries. We don't need the oil for our supply. It's the supply of other nations it will hurt. 
 
 Let Russia and China put the pressure on Iran. Russia has already offered to allow them to do their research there. Let France and Britian draw the line with Iran. We would have to be involved, but not the first one to jump on the table pointing fingers at Iran. 
 
 In the event that Iran did develop a nuclear bomb , or was close to one, Isaeral will strike first. They won't have a choice, at that point, for Isaeral, it's us or them. I hope it doesn't come to that.

 
 I hope I'm wrong; the immediate problem being our leadership is again drawing dramatic lines in the sand that can't be crossed to again refocus the US (and UK) public. That fear factor and the image of their government protecting them is, unfortunately, about all they can see. I can't help but wonder if Al Qaeda won't make another US attack to emphasize how unprotected we are in this unconventional circumstance due to our unnatural aggression.
